abstract: If you find that the pictures in the Mac’s Photos app are starting to crowd your computer’s internal storage, you can relocate them to an external drive.
snippet: If you find that the pictures in the Mac’s Photos app are starting to crowd your computer’s internal storage, you can relocate them to an external drive.
lead_paragraph: Q. I have a MacBook Air with a 128-gigabyte hard drive and have realized that it is fast filling up with high-resolution picture albums in the Photos app. I don’t use iCloud and don’t want to store my pictures online. How can I copy them to an external drive without messing up the Photos app?
